instruction: In an undirected dynamic graph, (u, v, t) means that node u and node v are linked with an undirected edge at time t.Your task is to  sort the edges by time from earliest to latest.
input: Given an undirected dynamic graph with the edges [(0, 1, 3), (1, 4, 4), (2, 3, 1)].  Sort the edges by time from earliest to latest. Give the answer as an array of (u, v, t) at the last of your response after 'Answer:'If the answer does not exist, please respond with 'Answer: []'.

instruction: In an undirected dynamic graph, (u, v, t) means that node u and node v are linked with an undirected edge at time t.Your task is to  sort the edges by time from earliest to latest.
input: Given an undirected dynamic graph with the edges [(0, 1, 3), (1, 4, 4), (2, 3, 1)].  Sort the edges by time from earliest to latest. Give the answer as an array of (u, v, t) at the last of your response after 'Answer:'If the answer does not exist, please respond with 'Answer: []'.
